div.head: Page 1
div.p: V. The single Sister Mary Elisab.th Baker. She writs writes herself: I am born the 9th of June 1737 at Berlin, My Parent did their best to keep me out of bad Companie Company. I often went alone to pray, but toock took myself soon better then other Poeple People. A.o 1743 I came to the Joy of my Heart in the Children Anstalt at Hhuth. 1746 I was among the Congregation of the Children received. I loved our Saviour & was taken for a pretty good Child, but as was grown older, then I begun to feel the Coruption Corruption of my Heart. A.o 49 I came in the Girls Choir & by that means in the Choir House. I was the same year received into the Congregation. A.o 52 I moved I came to Berlin again, where I in the Beginning

div.head: Page 2
div.p: about 1 Year went on without the Conexion Connection of the Congregation. After that, I instantly desireth, they would take me in their Care again, & soon our Saviour bestowed the Grace on me to pertake partake w.th the [?] germans there, on the holy Comunion Communion. A.o 57 I was receivd in the Sgg.e Sisters Choir, now begun my Desire, to be in the Congregation again to increase. I brought it very frequently before our dear Saviour & upon my incessant Desire our Sav.r made it that my Father gave me Leave to travel to Newsalz where I 1758 arrived. The following Year I partaketh on our Lords Supper. From this Time the Inclination of my Heart [?] was: to become Jesuslike, and according to the Desire of his Heart. A.o 1759 I emigrated with the whole Congregation of Newsalz hither & came in my Choir-House. By these Circumstances our Sav.r drew nearer to my Heart, & comforted me about all my Misery, so that I since very happely happily [?] proceedet. A.o 61 I was the first time by a Choir-Comunion Communion, which had a very Influenz Influence upon my Heart. So far herself. She was a very thoughtfull thoughtful Beeing Being & toock took every Thing very much at Heart, But far all

div.head: Page 3
div.p: For all that her chief Object was the Conversation w.th our dear Saviour. She became since a certain Time a consumptic Fever & by that was full of Hope soon to come to our Sav.r & this her Wish was fullfilled fulfilled to her the 29th of this Months a 10 a Clock in the Morning as her Mouth grow pale under the Blessing of her Choir in the 26th Year of her Age.
